trends: There have been no other sightings in Lower
This sighting has never been favorited.
divs: sighting details in september of 1981, i lived on village rd. , villas n.j. two houses from the delaware bay. it was a beautiful sunny day around 5:00 pm. after work i would take my louisville slugger to the bay to hit rocks out into water, watch the sunset, and blow off a long work day. i was watching where my rock would splash down when a ball of light, very bright white, like a welders arc flashed up and out from the water on a thirty degree angle, traveled at least a 1\2 mile or more, wavered for a split second like a wobble, shot back the direction it came from, then back up again on a 55 degree angle traveling two to three times the distance. two more shorter bursts in two different directions then shot out of site at about a 75 degree angle heading ssw. i think this all took about two to three seconds, never seen anything move that fast. my best guess is that it was around five miles out or more in the delaware bay the distances where probably alot more then what they appeared to me. the shape if anything was round and white hot. i stood there in disbelief. i looked down both sides of the beach looking to see if anyone else was there, just me. i didn' know what to think. when i tried explaining what i had seen to my friends a joke was made. one of my smarter friends told me it was ball lightning. i thought it was ball lightning after all was said, i had never seen ball lightning and it fit. the need to tell anyone else of this event was put on the shelf 27 years ago. 2008- my children where flicking through the channels six months or so ago and one of the ufo programs was on, some of the details sounded very familiar to that day 27 years ago. i started investigating ball lightning on the internet and realized that no way was this ball lightning. this realization has led me to this point, one of knowing that what i had witnessed was maybee a once in a life time and that i'm fortunate enough to see it over and over again. thanks
Summary: A ball of light, very bright white, like a welders arc flashed up and out from the water.
